projects.graph.utils

Class NeighborList

  • java.lang.Object
    • projects.graph.utils.NeighborList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<Neighbor>

    public class NeighborList
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<Neighbor>

    NeighborList is a simple linked list with head and tail references. It offers constant-time addition to the front and the back. It also offers methods for searching and deletion.

    The only reason for the existence of this list is because AdjacencyListGraph contains a single-dimensional raw array over lists of nodes. Creating a raw array of generics in Java is a pain, with several castings that are usually unsafe and flagged by the compiler as such (or making the runtime vulnerable). See the writeup for more.

    Finally, note that this class has been declared Iterable over Neighbor instances. This means that it implements a method called iterator() which returns an instance of Iterator over instances of the class Neighbor. As a result, this list can be looped through using a "for-each" loop. To make the iterator "fail-fast", we make sure that calls to Iterator.next() after calls to insertion or removal methods throw an instance of ConcurrentModificationException. If you want more information on "fail-fast" and "fail-safe" iterators, a good place to start would be the documentation of ConcurrentModificationException, located online here.

    See Also:
    Neighbor, AdjacencyListGraph

      • containsNeighbor

        public boolean containsNeighbor(int node)
        Asks the list about the existence of a particular neighbor.
        Parameters:
        node - The ID of the neighbor node.
        Returns:
        true if, and only if, node is a neighbor node of the node we called the method for, false otherwise.

      • remove

        public void remove(int node)
        If existent, removes the provided node from the neighbor list. Otherwise, has no effect.
        Parameters:
        node - The ID of the neighbor node.

      • setWeight

        public void setWeight(int node,
                      int weight)
        Sets the weight of node to weight.
        Parameters:
        node - The ID of the neighbor node.
        weight - The weight with which we want to associate the edge to the neighbor node.

      • getWeight

        public int getWeight(int node)
        Stores the (node, weight) pair at the back of the list.
        Parameters:
        node - The ID of the neighbor node.
        Returns:
        The weight of the edge between the node for which we called the method and the argument node.

      • getCount

        public int getCount()
        Queries the list about its count (number of nodes).
        Returns:
        The number of nodes in the list.
